intro: Aster microcephalus var. ovatus, commonly known as the ovate aster, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem with showy, violet to blue-purple florets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
